TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Window/VerticalThumb extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the vertical scroll box (also known as the thumb) of a window. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.Window.VerticalThumb class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the vertical scroll box of a window.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Window.VerticalThumb.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowVerticalThumb1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#423](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_117_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#423](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_117_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a vertical scroll box in the disabled state.
Docs.value: A that represents a vertical scroll box in the disabled state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowVerticalThumb4` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#426](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/61a02aa8-17ae-4cac-b9f3-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#426](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/61a02aa8-17ae-4cac-b9f3-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a vertical scroll box in the hot state.
Docs.value: A that represents a vertical scroll box in the hot state.

To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowVerticalThumb2` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a vertical scroll box in the normal state.
Docs.value: A that represents a vertical scroll box in the normal state.

remarks.format:
